meanings.definition: To call forth or bring back into existence again.
meanings.sent1: By reinvoking the ancient ritual, the villagers hoped to bring rain to their drought-stricken land.
meanings.sent2: She reinvoked the memories of her childhood by visiting her old neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The magician reinvoked the disappearing act, but this time, the rabbit refused to disappear!
meanings.sent4: The artist reinvoked the spirit of the Renaissance in her latest masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh bread baking in the oven reinvoked memories of her grandmother's kitchen.

meanings.definition: To summon or recall to mind or memory.
meanings.sent1: Reinvoking the lyrics of the song helped her remember the tune.
meanings.sent2: Whenever she smelled lavender, it reinvoked memories of her childhood garden.
meanings.sent3: The comedian reinvoked a hilarious childhood memory during his stand-up routine.
meanings.sent4: The old photograph reinvoked feelings of nostalgia for the good old days.
meanings.sent5: The sound of waves crashing on the shore reinvoked memories of their beach vacation.
